result.adr_address: Hong Kong, 旺角彌敦道550號龍馬大廈地下A號舖
result.formatted_address: Hong Kong, 旺角彌敦道550號龍馬大廈地下A號舖
result.name: Ajisen Ramen

reviews.text:
AMBIENCE
Seats appeared to be very limited but after tasting today's ramen, it would hardly matter and I would definitely return and blend in.

FOOD
Ajisen Ramen was really impressive in terms of flavor and texture. Broth was mighty tasty, not too strong, and served very hot. Using the huge spoon was fun for slurping down the broth! Noodles had a slightly chewy texture and that was enjoyable thanks to the acceptable thickness. Meat slices were so tender and very easy to break apart with chopsticks. Egg yolk's texture was interesting and delicious too.

BEVERAGE
Cold Lemon Tea was a drink I grew to appreciate. As we stayed in Hong Kong longer, I noticed many establishments serve healthier beverages and this was one of them. After pressing the lemon with my spoon, the taste was just right.

SERVICE
Waiting time was very reasonable but I wish the servers would at least look more cheerful. I understand work can be tiring but smiles would help us all look and feel refreshing and light. Nevertheless, I'll still do my best to throw some smiles out there if it can help. :) Banging ramen bowls down on the table during service may need to be looked into as well. It just feels rude to be served that way and it's very difficult to throw a smile for that. :)

Pretty cheap ramen, pretty good for the price. Obviously not the best ramen you can get. They have an afternoon (weekday?) special where the prices are discounted. I got it around 3pm.

However, on a separate occasion I arrived 30 minute before closing and was turned away.

It's a quick service chain restaurant so you should know what you're getting inasmuch as chain restaurant fare goes. Not the best, but far from terrible. Food quality is decent, bordering on slightly bland, but the quality of ingredients is good, which is way more important.

The place is always neat everytime I go there.
Food is always great.
If truth be told I find the quality is so so, not like its mother stores in Japan. It's adapted to suit Hong Kong's customer style. Price wise it's reasonable,  and service is ok.

reviews.text: 啲面又少味道唔好味。感覺好似一碗公仔麵

新城勁爆頒獎禮（英語：Hit Awards）是香港新城電台舉辦的一個本地音樂年度頒獎典禮，首屆於1992年以「新城勁爆家族音樂大賞」的名義舉行，後於1994年易名為「新城勁爆頒獎禮」（下簡稱「勁爆」）並一直沿用至今。

Pretty cheap ramen, pretty good for the price. Obviously not the best ramen you can get. They have an afternoon (weekday?) special where the prices are discounted. I got it around 3pm.

However, on a separate occasion I arrived 30 minute before closing and was turned away.

It's a quick service chain restaurant so you should know what you're getting inasmuch as chain restaurant fare goes. Not the best, but far from terrible. Food quality is decent, bordering on slightly bland, but the quality of ingredients is good, which is way more important.
